22#ifndef _SRCPOS_H_
23#define _SRCPOS_H_
24
25#include <stdio.h>
26#include <stdbool.h>
27#include "util.h"
28
29struct srcfile_state {
30 FILE *f;
31 char *name;
32 char *dir;
33 int lineno, colno;
34 struct srcfile_state *prev;
35};
36
37extern FILE *depfile; /* = NULL */
38extern struct srcfile_state *current_srcfile; /* = NULL */
39
40/**
41 * Open a source file.
42 *
43 * If the source file is a relative pathname, then it is searched for in the
44 * current directory (the directory of the last source file read) and after
45 * that in the search path.
46 *
47 * We work through the search path in order from the first path specified to
48 * the last.
49 *
50 * If the file is not found, then this function does not return, but calls
51 * die().
52 *
53 * @param fname Filename to search
54 * @param fullnamep If non-NULL, it is set to the allocated filename of the
55 * file that was opened. The caller is then responsible
56 * for freeing the pointer.
57 * @return pointer to opened FILE
58 */
59FILE *srcfile_relative_open(const char *fname, char **fullnamep);
60
61void srcfile_push(const char *fname);
62bool srcfile_pop(void);
63
64/**
65 * Add a new directory to the search path for input files
66 *
67 * The new path is added at the end of the list.
68 *
69 * @param dirname Directory to add
70 */
71void srcfile_add_search_path(const char *dirname);
72
73struct srcpos {
74 int first_line;
75 int first_column;
76 int last_line;
77 int last_column;
78 struct srcfile_state *file;
79};
80
81#define YYLTYPE struct srcpos
82
83#define YYLLOC_DEFAULT(Current, Rhs, N) \
84 do { \
85 if (N) { \
86 (Current).first_line = YYRHSLOC(Rhs, 1).first_line; \
87 (Current).first_column = YYRHSLOC(Rhs, 1).first_column; \
88 (Current).last_line = YYRHSLOC(Rhs, N).last_line; \
89 (Current).last_column = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, N).last_column; \
90 (Current).file = YYRHSLOC(Rhs, N).file; \
91 } else { \
92 (Current).first_line = (Current).last_line = \
93 YYRHSLOC(Rhs, 0).last_line; \
94 (Current).first_column = (Current).last_column = \
95 YYRHSLOC(Rhs, 0).last_column; \
96 (Current).file = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 0).file; \
97 } \
98 } while (0)
99
100
101/*
102 * Fictional source position used for IR nodes that are
103 * created without otherwise knowing a true source position.
104 * For example,constant definitions from the command line.
105 */
106extern struct srcpos srcpos_empty;
107
108extern void srcpos_update(struct srcpos *pos, const char *text, int len);
109extern struct srcpos *srcpos_copy(struct srcpos *pos);
110extern char *srcpos_string(struct srcpos *pos);
111
112extern void PRINTF(3, 0) srcpos_verror(struct srcpos *pos, const char *prefix,
113 const char *fmt, va_list va);
114extern void PRINTF(3, 4) srcpos_error(struct srcpos *pos, const char *prefix,
115 const char *fmt, ...);
116
117extern void srcpos_set_line(char *f, int l);
118
119#endif /* _SRCPOS_H_ */
